subject: DEBT PAID IN FULL
verse: After this, when Jesus knew that everything was now accomplished that the Scripture might be fulfilled, He said,  “I’m thirsty!” A jar full of sour wine was sitting there; so they fixed a sponge full of sour wine on hyssop and held it to His mouth, when Jesus had received the sour wine He said, “It Is finished!” then bowing His head, He gave up His spirit. (John 19:28-30)
reflection: Let us prayerfully examine our attitudes and behavior. Are we still unconsciously trying to earn God’s favor? Let us remember to thank Jesus for paying our debt in full. Remember we no longer need to be separated from God or fear death, Our Savior did for us what we could not do for ourselves.
prayer: Lord Jesus, help us to examine our hearts and recognize the fullness of Your sacrifice on our behalf. May we rest in the assurance of Your completed work, grateful that we no longer need to earn our salvation or fear separation from God. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 171d25f72d145af8
subject   : Subject: DEBT PAID IN FULL (5-2-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 1 May 2020 17:33:23 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*After this, when Jesus knew that every-thing **was now **accomplished that
the Scripture might be fulfilled, **He said, *

*“I’m thirsty!” A jar full of sour wine was*

*sitting there; so they fixed a sponge full of sour **wine on hyssop and
held it to His mouth, when **Jesus had received the sour wine He said, “It **Is
finished!” then bowing His head, He gave **up His spirit. *(Jn. 19:28-30)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Let us prayerfully examine our attitudes and behavior. Are we still
unconsciously trying to earn God’s favor? Let us remember to thank Jesus
for paying our debt in full.* Remember we no longer need to be separated **from
God or fear death, Our Savior did for us what **we could not do for
ourselves.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: BEING WILLING TO HELP IN PATIENCE
verse: For the message of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God. (I Corinthians 1:18)
reflection:
No one is beyond His reach. Every person who has accepted the Lord’s salvation needs to be interceding for a person’s
salvation.
When we are together with a loved one we should draw the Lord’s name into the conversation. Will the Lord
grant this person eternal life? There is no way to know. Jesus alone decides who, what, why, and the when of each soul’s destiny. Each of us need to be willing to step aside as He leads waiting, and watching, in hope and faith.
prayer: Gracious God, guide us to intercede for the salvation of others and to gently share Your love in our conversations. Help us trust in Your perfect timing and wisdom for each soul's destiny, as we faithfully wait and watch in hope. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 171d780ae7ad6280
subject   : Subject: BEING WILLING TO HELP IN PATIENCE (5-3-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 2 May 2020 17:27:47 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*For the message of the cross is foolish-ness to those who **are perishing,
but to us who are being saved it is the **power of God. *(I Cor. 1:18)



*Today’s Reflection:*

No one is beyond His reach. Every person who has accepted the Lord’s
salvation needs to be interceding for a person’s

salvation. When we are together with a loved one we should draw the Lord’s
name into the conversation. Will the Lord

grant this person eternal life? There is no way to know. Jesus alone
decides who, what, why, and the when of each soul’s destiny. Each of us
need to be *willing* to step aside as He leads— *waiting, and watching, in
hope and faith.*

*Pastor Sather*

subject: JOY IN THE TIME OF TRIALS
verse: Count it all joy my brethren, when you meet various trials, for you know the testing of your faith produces steadfastness. (James 1:2-3)
reflection:
This is truly a “testing of our faith”; I say this because it calls us to believe in the goodness of God, and to trust that He is not only willing but able to accomplish His purpose, no matter what befalls us. Any difficulty, whether great or small, is an occasion for joy, but only when we remind ourselves of the nature of the God
who loves us and wills only the best for us.Think about your hardest struggle. Thank Jesus that He will use it to strengthen your Faith.
prayer: Faithful God, help us to trust in Your goodness and love, even in the midst of our greatest struggles, and grant us the strength to find joy in every trial as we grow in faith. Thank You for using our challenges to refine and strengthen us, drawing us closer to You. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verses:*

*Count it all joy my brethren, when you meet **various trials, for you know
the testing of **your faith produces steadfastness. *(Jm. 1:2-3)



*Today's Reflection:*

This is truly a “testing of our faith”; I say this because it calls us to
believe in the goodness of God, and to trust that He is not only willing but
able to accomplish His purpose, no matter what befalls us. Any difficulty,
whether great or small, is an occasion for joy, but only when we remind
ourselves of the nature of the God

who loves us and wills only the best for us.*Think about your hardest
struggle. Thank **Jesus that He will use it to strengthen your **Faith.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: OUR MATCHLESS CHRIST
verse: Long ago. . . the Lord spoke to out father by the prophets, but in these last days He has spoken to us by His Son. . .through whom also He created the world.  (Hebrews 1:1-2)
reflection: God used many approaches to send His messages to people in the Old T. times. Jewish people familiar with this would not have found it hard to believe that God was still revealing His will, but it was astonishing for them to think that God had revealed Himself by speaking through His Son, Jesus Christ. Jesus has been the fulfillment and culmination of God’s revelation through the centuries. When we know Him, we have all we need to be saved from our sin and to have a perfect relationship with God.
prayer: Eternal God, thank You for revealing Yourself fully through Your Son, Jesus Christ, who is the ultimate fulfillment of Your word and the perfect way to salvation. Help us to know Him more deeply and to embrace the complete relationship with You that He offers. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 171e1d37495d0d32
subject   : Subject: OUR MATCHLESS CHRIST (5-5-20)

to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 4 May 2020 17:34:24 -0500

Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*Long ago. . . the Lord spoke to out father by the prophets, **but in these
last days He has spoken to us by His Son. . .**through whom also He created
the world. *

(Heb. 1:1-2)



*Today’s reflection:*

God used many approaches to send His messages to people in the Old T.
times. Jewish people familiar with this would not have found it hard to
believe that

God was still revealing His will, *but* it was astonishing for them to
think that God had revealed *Himself* by speaking

through His Son, Jesus Christ. Jesus has

been the fulfillment and culmination of God’s revelation through the
centuries. *When we know Him, we have all we need **to be saved from our
sin and to have a perfect relationship **with God.*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: AN HONEST ASSESSMENT OF ONE-SELF
verse: He must increase, but I must decrease.  (John 3:30)
reflection: John’s willingness to decrease in importance shows unusual humility. Many Christian leaders are often tempted to focus more on their own success then on the God who gives us the ability. Beware of those who put more emphasis on there own achievements than on God’s Kingdom. A question we need to ask ourselves is: Are there any parts of my life where I need to invite Jesus to increase?
prayer: Holy God, help us to cultivate true humility in our hearts, decreasing our focus on personal achievements and increasing our devotion to Your Kingdom. Grant us the wisdom to recognize areas where we need to surrender more fully to Jesus, allowing His presence and purpose to grow in our lives. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*He must increase, but I must decrease. *

(Jn. 3:30)



*Today’s Reflection:*

John’s willingness to decrease in importance shows unusual humility. Many
Christian leaders are often tempted to focus more on their own success then
on the God who gives us the ability. Beware of those who put more emphasis on
there own achievements than

on God’s Kingdom. *A question we need to **ask ourselves is: Are there any
parts of my life where **I need to invite Jesus to increase**?*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: HAVING GODLY WORTH
verse: Then God said,  “Let us  make people in our image, to be like ourselves. They will be masters over all life—the fish in the sea, the birds in the sky, and all the livestock, wild animals, and small animals.” (Genesis 1:26)
reflection:
I believe it is important that we take note of the fact that God uses the plural form when speaking about the creation of mankind.
Knowing that we are made in God’s image and
so share many of His characteristics provides a solid basis for self-worth. Human worth is not based on possessions, achievements, physical attractiveness, or public acclaim. Instead , it is based on being made in God’s image. Because
we bear God’s image, we can feel positive about ourselves. Criticizing or downgrading ourselves is criticizing what God has made and the abilities He has given us.
prayer: Almighty God, help us to recognize and cherish the divine image within ourselves and others, finding our true worth in Your creation rather than worldly measures. May we honor the abilities You've given us and treat ourselves and our fellow humans with the respect and dignity befitting those made in Your likeness. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*Then God said, **“Let us* * make people in our image, to be **like
ourselves. They will be masters **over all life—the fish **in the sea, the
birds in the sky, and all the livestock, wild*

*animals, and small animals.” *(Gen. 1:26)



*Today’s Reflection:*

I believe it is important that we take note of the fact that God uses the
plural form when speaking about the creation of mankind. Knowing that we
are made in God’s image and

so share many of His characteristics provides a solid basis for self-worth.
Human worth *is not* based on possessions, achievements, physical
attractiveness, or public acclaim. *Instead*, it is based on being made in
God’s image. Because

we bear God’s image, we can feel positive about ourselves*.* *Criticizing
or downgrading ourselves is criticizing what **God has made and the
abilities He has given us.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: TRUST THE LORD FULLY
verse: Cast all your anxiety on Him because He cares for you. (1 Peter 5:7)
reflection:
It is easy today to fall into the trap of anxiety with the dangers of the virus that has become so prevalent. But carrying your worries, stresses, and daily struggles by yourself shows that you have not trusted God fully with your life. It takes humility, however, to recognize that God cares. To admit your need, and let others in
God’s family help you, BUT sometimes we think that struggles are caused by our own sin and foolishness are not God’s concern. But when we turn to God in repentance, He
will bear the weight even of those struggles. Letting God have your anxieties calls for action, not passivity. Don’t submit to circumstances but to the Lord who controls circumstances.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to trust You fully with our lives, humbly admitting our need for Your care and the support of our faith community. Grant us the courage to turn to You in repentance and action, submitting our anxieties to Your loving control. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*Cast all your anxiety on Him because He cares for you. *(1 Pet. 5:7)




*Today’s Reflection: *It is easy today to fall into the trap of anxiety
with the dangers of the *virus* that has become so prevalent. But carrying
your worries, stresses, and daily struggles by yourself shows that you have
not trusted God fully with your life. It takes humility, however, to
recognize that God cares. To admit your need, and let others in

God’s family help you, BUT sometimes we think that struggles are caused by
our own sin and foolishness are not God’s concern. *But* when we turn to
God in repentance, He

will bear the weight even of those struggles. Letting God have your
anxieties calls for action, not passivity. *Don’t submit* *to circumstances
but to the Lord who **controls *

*circumstances. *

*Pastor Sather*

subject: FACING FEAR
verse:
There is no fear in love, but perfect love cats out fear.
For fear has to do with punishment, and who ever fears has not be perfected in love. (I John 4:18)
reflection:
If we are ever afraid of the future, eternity, or God’s judgment, we need to remind ourselves of God’s love.
We know that God loves us perfectly (Romans 8:38-39).
We can resolve our fears first by focusing on His immeasurable love for us, and then by allowing Him to love others through us. His love will quiet your fears and give you confidence.
prayer: Loving God, help us to remember Your perfect and immeasurable love for us when we face fears about the future or Your judgment. May we find confidence in Your love and allow it to flow through us to others, quieting our anxieties and strengthening our faith. (AI)
original_content:

*Subject: FACING FEAR *(5-9-20)



*Today’s Verse:*

*There is no fear in love, but perfect love cats out **fear. For fear has
to do with punishment, and who **ever fears has not be perfected in love. *(I
Jn. 4:18)



*Today’s Reflection:*

If we are ever afraid of the future, eternity, or God’s judgement, we need
to remind ourselves of God’s love. We know that God loves us perfectly (Ro.
8:38-39). We can resolve our fears first by focusing on His immeasurable
love for us, and then by allowing Him to love others through us. *His
love **will
quiet your fears and give you confidence.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: MOTHER'S DAY
verse: Husbands must love their wives with the  same love Christ showed the church. He  gave up His life for her. (Ephesians 5:25)
reflection:
(Tell Her So)
Amid the cares of married life,
In spite of toil and business strife,
If you love your wife,
Tell her so!
There was a time you thought it bliss
To get the favor of a kiss;
A dozen now won’t come amiss Tell her so!
Do not act as if she has passed her prime,
As though to please her were a crime If ever you loved her, now is the time;
To tell her so!
Never let her heart grow cold;
Richer beauties will unfold.
She is worth her weight in gold;
Tell her so!
prayer: Faithful God, help us cherish and express our love for our spouses, remembering the preciousness of our relationships and the importance of showing affection. May we always find ways to honor and uplift our partners, nurturing the bonds that unite us. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*Husbands must love their wives with the *

*same love **Christ showed the church. He *

*gave up His life for **her. *(Eph. 5:25)



*Today’s Reflection: (Tell Her So)*

Amid the cares of married life,

In spite of toil and business strife,

If you love your wife,

Tell her so!



There was a time you thought it bliss

To get the favor of a kiss;

A dozen now won’t come amiss—

Tell her so!



Do not act as if she has passed her prime,

As though to please her were a crime—

If ever you loved her, now is the time;

To tell her so!



Never let her heart grow cold;

Richer beauties will unfold.

She is worth her weight in gold;

Tell her so!

* Pastor Sather*

subject: THE ONLY PASSWORD
verse: Salvation is found in no one else, for there is no other name under heaven given to mankind by which we must be saved. (Acts 4:12)
reflection:
Jesus himself said, “I am the way, the truth,
and the life. No one can come to the Father
except through me.” (John 14:6) Jesus offers
the only safe and secure entry into His
kingdom, where there is righteousness,
peace and true happiness. The password
has been revealed. Jesus is the pass word to the kingdom.
prayer: Lord Jesus, thank You for being the way, the truth, and the life—our sure path to the Father and His kingdom. Help us to trust in You alone as our password to eternal life, filled with righteousness, peace, and true joy. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*Salvation is found in no one else, for there is no*

*other name under heaven given to mankind by*

*which we must be saved. *(Acts 4:12)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus himself said, “I am the way, the truth,

and the life. No one can come to the Father

except through me.” (Jn. 14:6) Jesus offers

the only safe and secure entry into His

kingdom, where there is righteousness,

peace and true happiness. The password

has been revealed. *Jesus is the pass word *

*to the kingdom.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: HOW TO SAVE FRIENDSHIPS
verse:
Don’t sin by letting anger gain control over you.
Don’t let the sin go down while you are still angry. (Ephesians 4:26)
reflection:
The Bible doesn’t tell us we should not feel angry, but it points out that it is important to handle our anger properly. If vented thoughtlessly, anger can hurt others and destroy relationships. If bottled up inside, it can cause us to become bitter and destroy us from within. Paul tells us to deal with our anger immediately. If we nurse our anger, we will give
Satin an opportunity to divide us. “Are you angry with someone right now? What can you do to resolve your differences?--Don’t let the day end before you begin to work on mending your differences.
prayer: Holy God, help us to handle our anger wisely and promptly, resolving conflicts with others before they fester and give Satan a foothold. Grant us the strength and humility to mend our differences, preserving unity and demonstrating Your love in our relationships. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17205c2829847676
subject   : Subject: HOW TO SAVE FRIENDSHIPS (5-12-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 11 May 2020 17:02:13 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Don’t sin by letting anger gain control over*

*you. Don’t let the sin go down while you are*

*still angry. *(Eph. 4:26)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The Bible doesn’t tell us we should not feel angry, but it points out that
it is important to handle our anger properly. If vented thought-lessly,
anger can hurt others and destroy relationships. If bottled up inside, it
can cause us to become bitter and destroy us from within. Paul tells us to
deal with our anger immed-iately. If we nurse our anger, we will give

Satin an opportunity to divide us. “*Are you angry **with* *someone right
now? What can you do to **resolve* *your differences*?--*Don’t let the day
end **before* *you begin to work on mend-ing your **differences.*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: BEING OPEN TO HIS GUIDANCE
verse: The Lord says, “I will guide you along the best pathway for your life. I will advise you and watch over you.” (Psalm 32:8)
reflection: When we yield our lives to Jesus, we never know what the outcome will be, but he always comes through for us. When we believe and obey Jesus, in spite of unfavorable circumstances, we receive tremendous blessings He’s already prepared for us. What is Jesus instructing you to do? Are you ready to obey?
prayer: Gracious God, help us to trust and obey Jesus even when circumstances seem unfavorable, knowing that You have prepared blessings beyond our imagination. Give us the courage to yield our lives fully to Your will and follow Your instructions without hesitation. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*The Lord says, “I will guide you along the best **pathway for your life. I
will advise you and **watch over you.” *(Ps. 32:8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

When we yield our lives to Jesus, we never know what the outcome will be,
but he always comes through for us. When we believe and obey Jesus, in
spite of unfavor-able circumstances, we receive tremendous blessings He’s
already prepared for us.

*What is Jesus* *instructing you to do? Are you **ready to* *obey?*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: TO NEED AND BE NEEDED
verse: I appeal to you for my son Onesimus, who became my son while I was in chains. Formerly he was useless to you, but now he has become useful to you and to me.”  (Philippians 1:10, 11)
reflection:
Here are three question to ask yourself.
What use am I in the world?
Has my life really made a difference in
anything?
Would anything be appreciably different
if I were not here?
What is the old saying about putting your
hand in a pail of water and withdrawing it:
the hole that remains is how much you will
be missed when you are gone! I am not pes simistic, depressed, or tired of living, but in
reality, I have to recognize that my life has
not made much of an impact on the world,
certainly nothing like I had intended when
I was 18 years old. But let us remember that
the human worth is not measured only in
terms of fame, fortune, or some social influence. Perhaps the greatest measure of our value is how much we are needed by some other human being.
No one is really useless unless they have given up on life and love.
prayer: Faithful God, help us to recognize our true worth not in worldly measures, but in the love we share and the lives we touch, however small our impact may seem. Grant us the wisdom to see that our value lies in being needed and loved by others, and in never giving up on life and love. (AI)

*Today's Verse:*

*I appeal to you for my son Onesimus, who*

*became my son while I was in chains. Formerly he was useless to you, but
now*

*he has become useful to **you and to me.” * (Phil. 1:10, 11)

*Today’s Reflection:*

Here are three question to ask yourself.

*What use am I in the world*?

*Has my life really made a difference in*

*anything?*

*Would anything be appreciably different*

*if I were not here?*

What is the old saying about putting your

hand in a pail of water and withdrawing it:

the hole that remains is how much you will

be missed when you are gone! I am not pes-

simistic, depressed, or tired of living, but in

reality, I have to recognize that my life has

not made much of an impact on the world,

certainly nothing like I had intended when

I was 18 years old. But let us remember that

the human worth is not measured only in

terms of fame, fortune, or some social influence. Perhaps the greatest
measure of our value is how much we are needed by some other human being. *No
one is really useless unless they **have given up on life and love.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: FOCUSING ON JESUS FOR PEACE
verse: You will keep in perfect peace those whose minds are steadfast, because they trust in You. (Isaiah 26:3)
reflection:
Do you struggle with trust? Do you struggle with believing that Jesus can work in and through you when you doubt yourself? Let us remember that Jesus promises if we trust in Him, He will fill us with perfect peace. We need to rip our eyes off our fear
of the unknown. We need to fix our minds on His goodness, strength, and purpose. We need to fix our mind on His great love, hope and joy. Are you in an anxious, vulnerable place right now?
Entrust your fears to Jesus today, knowing that He promises to fill you with His perfect peace.
prayer: Loving God, help us to trust in You fully, even when we doubt ourselves, and to fix our minds on Your goodness, strength, and purpose rather than our fears. Fill us with Your perfect peace as we entrust our anxieties and vulnerabilities to You, Lord Jesus. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 172155150d4d522d

date      : Thu, 14 May 2020 17:32:30 -0500

*Today’s Verse:*

*You will keep in perfect peace those whose minds **are steadfast, because
they trust in You. *(Isa. 26:3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Do you struggle with trust? Do you struggle with believing that Jesus can
work in and through you when you doubt yourself? Let us remember that
Jesus promises if we trust in Him, He will fill us with perfect peace. We
need to rip our eyes off our fear

of the unknown. We need to fix our minds on His goodness, strength, and
purpose. We need to fix our mind on His great love, hope and joy. Are you
in an anxious, vulnerable place right now?

*Entrust your fears to Jesus today, knowing that **He promises to fill you
with His perfect peace.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: LET US BE AWARE OF JESUS BLESSINGS
verse: Raise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of compassion and the God of all comfort, who comforts us in all our troubles, so we can comfort those in any trouble with the comfort we ourselves receive from God. (2 Corinthians 1:3,4)
reflection:
We often receive special blessings from our grandchildren, which in many cases are like the blessing Jesus sends us. When we open our Bibles, words may jump off the page, that are exactly what we need to hear. A song may open our heart and stir us to worship. A friend may call or text or email
with an encouraging note. In either of these cases we should recognize that Jesus is pouring out His love to us. This is His compassion acknowledging our hurt which will never belittle us. His tenderness helps us receive His grace, and His strength empowers us to endure and offer His comfort to others.
prayer: Merciful God, we thank You for the countless ways You pour out Your love and compassion upon us through unexpected blessings, timely words, and the kindness of others. Help us to recognize Your presence in these moments and empower us to extend Your comfort to those around us. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1721a9b5804b14d6
subject   : Subject: LET US BE AWARE OF JESUS BLESSINGS (5-16-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 15 May 2020 18:11:28 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*Raise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus **Christ, the Father of
compassion and the God of **all comfort, who comforts us in all our
troubles, **so we can comfort those in any trouble with the **comfort we
ourselves receive from God. *(2 Cor. 1:3,4)



*Today’s Reflection:*

We often receive special blessings from our gradchildren, which in many
cases are like the blessing Jesus sends us. When we open our Bibles, words may
jump off the page, that are exactly what we need to hear. A song may open
our heart and stir us to

worship. A friend may call or text or email

with an encouraging note. In either of these cases we should recognize that
Jesus is pouring out His love to us. This is His compassion acknowledging our
hurt which will never belittle us. *His tenderness*

*helps us receive His grace, and His strength **empowers us to endure and
offer His comfort to **others.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: THE FIRST DISCIPLES FOLLOW JESUS
verse: When Jesus saw Nathanael approaching, He said . . . “Here truly is an Israelite in whom there is no deceit.” (John 1:47)
reflection: Jesus knew about Nathanael before the two ever met. Jesus also knows what we are really like. An honest person will feel comfortable with the thought that Jesus knows him or her through and through. A dishonest person will feel uncomfortable. You cannot pretend your something you are not. Remember God knows the real you and wants you to follow Him.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to embrace the truth that You know us completely, and grant us the courage to be authentic in our faith and actions. May we find comfort in Your perfect understanding and respond to Your call to follow You wholeheartedly. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1721f8e8fb0536e9
subject   : Subject: THE FIRST DISCIPLES FOLLOW JESUS (5-17-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 16 May 2020 17:15:36 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*When Jesus saw Nathanael approaching, He said **. . . **“Here truly is an
Israelite in whom there is no deceit.” *(Jn. 1:47)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus knew about Nathanael before the two ever met. Jesus also knows what
we are really like. An honest person will feel comfortable with the thought
that Jesus

knows him or her through and through. A dishonest person will feel
uncomfortable. You cannot pretend your something you are not. *Remember
God **knows the real you and wants you to follow Him.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: PLACING ALL HOPE IN GOD
verse: From the end of the earth will I cry unto thee, when my heart is overwhelmed: lead me to the rock that is higher than I. (Psalm 61:2)
reflection: Knowing that God is in control allows us to wait patiently for Him to rescue us. True relief does not always come when a problem is resolved, because more problems are usually on the way! True relief comes from an enduring hope in God’s ultimate salvation. His all surpassing strength is always with us.
prayer: Faithful God, grant us the patience to trust in Your perfect timing and the strength to endure life's challenges, knowing that our ultimate hope rests in Your unfailing love and eternal salvation. Help us to find peace in Your presence, even amidst life's storms. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17224d7d4812c49b
subject   : Subject: PLACING ALL HOPE IN GOD (5-18-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 17 May 2020 17:53:44 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*From the end of the earth will I cry unto thee, when **my heart is
overwhelmed: lead me to the rock that is **higher than I. *(Ps. 61:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Knowing that God is in control allows us

to wait patiently for Him to rescue us. True relief does not always come when
a problem is resolved, *because *more problems are usually on the way*!*
True relief comes from an enduring hope in God’s ultimate salvation. *His
all surpass-ing **strength is always* *with us.*

*Pastor Sather*

subject: FINDING TRUE POWER
verse: I will come to you soon, if the Lord wills, and I will find out not the talk of these arrogant people but their power. For the kingdom of God depends not on talk but on power. (1 Corinthians 4:19, 20)
reflection:
What I am learning about God from these devotions is, “God talk” is that it doesn’t always have to do with the words we use when we speak with others. But it has everything to do with the spiritual ears
we use in our relationship with Jesus. That is where the power is!
prayer: Holy God, open our spiritual ears to hear Your voice clearly and deepen our relationship with Jesus, for in this intimate connection we find true power and transformation. May we grow in our ability to listen and discern Your will, not just through words, but through the quiet whispers of Your Spirit. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1722a0f6fd977afd
subject   : Subject: FINDING TRUE POWER (5-20-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 18 May 2020 18:12:34 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*I will come to you soon, if the Lord wills, and I will **find out not the
talk of these arrogant people but **their power. For the kingdom of God
depends not **on talk but on power. *(1 Cor. 4:19, 20)



*Today’s Reflection:*

What I am learning about God from these devotions is, “God talk” is that it
doesn’t always have to do with the words we use when we speak with others. But
it has everything to do with the spiritual ears

we use in our relationship with Jesus.

*That is **where the power is!*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: MAKING ALL THINGS NEW
verse: I saw the Holy City, the new Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven, from God, prepared as a bride beautifully dressed for her husband (Revelation 21:2)
reflection:
The new Jerusalem is where God lives among His people.
Instead of us going up to meet Him, He comes down to be with us, just as God became a man in Jesus Christ and lived among us (John 1:14). Wherever God reigns there is peace, security, and love.
prayer: Eternal God, as we contemplate the new Jerusalem where You dwell among Your people, fill our hearts with the peace, security, and love that flow from Your presence. May we eagerly anticipate the day when You will make Your home with us, just as You did through Jesus Christ. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1722f4264df3acd5
subject   : Subject: MAKING ALL THINGS NEW (5-20-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 19 May 2020 18:26:20 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*I saw the Holy City, the new Jerusalem, coming **down out of heaven, from
God, prepared as a **bride beautifully **dressed for her husband *(Rev.
21:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The new Jerusalem is where God lives among His people. Instead of us going
up to meet Him, He comes down to be with us, just as God became a man in
Jesus Christ and lived among us (Jn. 1:14).

*Wherever God reigns there is peace, security, **and love.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: PROTECTING OUR TRUE PURPOSE
verse:
If you try to keep your life for yourself, you will lose it.
But if you give up your life for me, you will find true life. (Matthew 16:25)
reflection:
The possibility of losing their lives was very real for the disciples as well as for Jesus. Real discipleship implies real commitment-pledging our whole
existence to His service. If we try to save our physical life from death, pain and discomfort, we may risk losing eternal life. If we protect ourselves from the pain God calls for us to suffer, we begin to die spiritually and emotion ally. Our lives turn inward,
and we lose our intended purpose. When we give our life in service to Christ, however, we discover the real purpose of living.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to embrace true discipleship by committing our whole lives to Your service, even in the face of discomfort or danger. May we find our deepest purpose and eternal life as we give ourselves fully to following Christ. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1723455aed6e2c17
subject   : Subject: PROTECTING OUR TRUE PURPOSE (5-21-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 20 May 2020 18:05:30 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*If you try to keep your life for yourself, you will lose **it. But if you
give up your life for me, you will find **true life. *(Mt. 16:25)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The possibility of losing their lives was very real for the disciples as
well as for Jesus. *Real* discipleship implies *real *commitment—pledging
our whole

existence to His service. If we try to

save our physical life from death, pain

and discomfort, we may risk losing

eternal life. If we protect ourselves

from the pain God calls for us to suffer,

we begin to die spiritually and emotion-

ally. Our lives turn inward,

and we lose our intended purpose. *When we give **our life in service* *to
Christ, however, we discover **the real purpose*

*of living.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: SEPARATING THE SUPERFICIALLY COMMITTED
verse: He cuts off every branch that doesn’t produce fruit, and He prunes the branches that do produce fruit so they will produce even more fruit. (John 15:2)
reflection:
Jesus makes a distinction between two kinds of pruning: (1) cutting off and (2) cutting back branches. Fruitful branches are cut back to promote growth. In other words, God must sometimes discipline us to strengthen our character and faith. But branches that do not bear fruit are cut
off at the trunk not only because they are worthless, but also because they often infect the rest of the tree. People who don’t bear fruit for God or who try to block the efforts of God’s followers will be cut off from His life giving power.
prayer: Faithful God, help us to remain fruitful branches, accepting Your loving discipline to strengthen our character and faith, and guide us to bear abundant fruit for Your kingdom. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 172396d7e87c3243
subject   : Subject: SEPARATING THE SUPERFICIALLY COMMITTED (5-22-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 21 May 2020 17:49:37 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*He cuts off every branch that doesn’t produce fruit, a**nd He prunes the
branches that do produce fruit **so they will produce even more fruit. *(Jn.
15:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus makes a distinction between two kinds of pruning: (1) cutting off
and (2) cutting back branches. Fruitful branches

are cut back to promote growth. In other words, God must sometimes
discipline us to strengthen our character and faith. But branches that do
not bear fruit are cut

off at the trunk not only because they are worthless, but also because they
often infect the rest of the tree. *People **who *

*don’t bear fruit for God* *or who try to block the **efforts of God’s
followers will be cut off from His life **giving power.*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: REALIZING THE NEED FOR DAILY PRAYER
verse: Keep alert and pray. Otherwise temptation will over power you. For the spirit is willing enough, the body is weak.  (Matthew 26:41)
reflection:
Paul said we should pray continuously, because there are always forces around us trying to pull us into temptation, away from our walk with Christ.
We cannot afford to consider prayer as an option. Rather it is a daily necessity. Just as Jesus gained strength and clarity in prayer, we can too. Are you spending quiet prayer time with Jesus daily?
prayer: Holy God, strengthen our resolve to pray continuously, drawing closer to You and resisting the temptations that surround us. Help us to prioritize daily quiet time with Jesus, finding strength and clarity through our communion with You. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1723e4ca8bd88342

date      : Fri, 22 May 2020 16:31:51 -0500

Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Keep alert and pray. Otherwise temptation will **over power you. For the
spirit is willing enough, **the body is weak. *

(Mt. 26:41)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Paul said we should pray continuously, *because *there are always forces
around

us trying to pull us into temptation, away from our walk with Christ. We
cannot afford to consider prayer as an option.

*Rather* it is a daily necessity. Just as

Jesus gained strength and clarity in

prayer, we can too. *Are you spending quiet prayer **time with Jesus daily?*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: OUR OBLIGATION AS CHRISTIANS
verse:
By this we know that we love the children of God, when we love God and obey His commandments.
For this is the love of God, that we keep His commandments. And His Commandments are not burdensome. (1 John 5:2-3)
reflection: When we become Christians, we become part of God’s family; with fellow believers as our brothers and sisters. It is God who determines who the other family members are, not us. We are simply called to accept and love them. How well do you treat your fellow family members?
prayer: Loving God, help us to embrace all our brothers and sisters in Christ with open hearts, recognizing that you have chosen each one as part of your family. May we treat our fellow believers with the same love and acceptance you have shown us, strengthening the bonds of our spiritual family. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17243ba56b3b763a
subject   : Subject: OUR OBLIGATION AS CHRISTIANS (5-24-20)

date      : Sat, 23 May 2020 17:49:45 -0500

Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verses:*

*By this we know that we love the children of **God, when we love God and
obey His com**mandments. For this is the love of God, that **we keep His
commandments. And His Com**mandments are not burdensome. *(1 Jn.5:2-3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

When we become Christians, we become part of God’s family; with fellow
believers as our brothers and sisters. It is God who determines who the
other family members are, not us. We are simply called to accept and love
them. *How **well do you treat your fellow family members?*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: THE IMPORTANCE OF SELF-SACRIFICIAL LOVE
verse: Don’t think only about your own affairs,  but be interested in others, too, and what they are doing. (Philippians 2:4)
reflection:
Like earthly parents, God feels pleasure when He sees his children doing things worth bragging about.
And what better way to please Him than imitating Jesus. That means serving others with a self sacrificial love-even when it’s inconven ient or costly. Putting others needs above our own desires. Grabbing every opportunity to be the hands and feet of Jesus. Every day we have the chance to give more reason for God to feel proud of us.
prayer: Let's remember those who went the distance sacrificing themselves for our freedom.
original_content:
message_id: 17248e6d98b8ec11

*Today’s Verse:*

*Don’t think only about your own affairs, *

*but be interested in others, too, and what*

*they are doing. *(Phil. 2:4)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Like earthly parents, God feels pleasure when He sees his children doing
things worth bragging about. And what better

way to please Him than imitating Jesus. That means serving others with a
self-

sacrificial love—even when it’s inconven-

ient or costly. Putting others needs above our own desires. Grabbing every
oppor-tunity to be the hands and feet of Jesus. *Every day we have **the
chance to give more reason for God to feel **proud of us.*

* Pastor Sather*

*Let's remember those who went the distance sacrificing **themselves for
our freedom. *

subject: PATIENT ENDURANCE
verse: The good soil represents honest goodhearted people who hear God’s message, cling to it, and steadily produce a huge harvest. (Luke 8:15)
reflection:
Many of our garden seeds when we have planted them, if they are truly cared for, they send their roots down deep. They go down deep into the good soil, likewise the Word takes root and grows to bear fruit. Its like they are stubborn about it. And
apparently the fruit doesn’t always come fast and easy.
It takes patient endurance. This means we may fall down, but we get back up. We may doubt, but we refuse to give up our faith. We get tired, but we keep fighting the good fight. Draw a picture of what speaks to you about this parable. Then hang it on your fridge to remind you to tend your heart’s garden and water it with faith.
prayer: Almighty God, we thank You for Your Word that takes root in our hearts and grows with patient endurance. Help us to nurture our faith, persevere through challenges, and bear fruit for Your kingdom, even when growth seems slow or difficult. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1724dc3eb2840be0
subject   : Subject: PATIENT ENDURANCE (5-26-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 25 May 2020 16:36:25 -0500
===================================================================

===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*The good soil represents honest good-hearted people **who hear God’s
message, cling to it, and steadily **produce a huge harvest. *(Lk. 8:15)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Many of our garden seeds when we have planted them, if they are truly cared
for, they send their roots down deep. They go down deep into the good soil,
likewise the Word takes root and grows to bear fruit. Its like they are
stubborn about it. And

apparently the fruit doesn’t always come fast and easy. It takes patient
endurance. This means we may fall down, but we get back up. We may doubt, but
we refuse to give up our faith. We get tired, but we keep fighting the good
fight. *Draw a **picture of what speaks to you about this parable.*

*Then hang it on your fridge to remind you to **tend your heart’s garden
and water it with f**aith.*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: OVERCOMING THE FEAR OF DEATH
verse: The Lord’s loved ones are precious to Him; it grieves Him when they die. (Psalm 116:15)
reflection:
God stays close to us even in death. When
someone we love is nearing death, we may
become angry and feel abandoned. But
believers (the Lord’s loved ones) are precious to God, and He carefully chooses the time when they will be called into His presence. Let this truth provide comfort when you have lost a loved one. Do you struggle with The fear of death? Whenever that fear surfaces, think about how much Jesus longs to bring you home to Himself.
prayer: Faithful God, help us trust in Your perfect timing and loving care, even as we face the pain of loss and the fear of death. Draw us close to Your comforting presence and remind us of the eternal hope we have in Jesus Christ. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*The Lord’s loved ones are precious to Him;*

*it grieves Him when they die. *(Ps. 116:15)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God stays close to us even in death. When

someone we love is nearing death, we may

become angry and feel abandoned. But

believers (*the Lord’s loved ones) *are precious to God, and He carefully
chooses the time when they will be called into His presence. Let this truth
provide comfort when you have lost a loved one. Do you struggle with The
fear of death?* Whenever that fear **surfaces, think about how much
Jesus **longs
to bring you home to Himself.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: RECEIVING TRUE NOURISHMENT
verse:
Jesus said, “I am the living bread that came down from heaven. Whoever eats  this bread will live forever.
This bread is my flesh, which I will give for the life of  the world.” (John 6:51)
reflection:
Have we ever taken the time to study the list of medications and supplements we take, much of which our human bodies can normally get from a healthy diet
and ten minutes of fresh air and sunshine an provide. How often do we do the same with our spiritual health?
We depend on supplements-some else’s insights, Sunday sermons, a brief nugget heard on T V, as our entire spiritual intake for the week. We lean on supplements rather than a rich diet of daily Bible reading, prayer time, and reflection with Jesus. In (John 15:7) He says we should “abide” with Him. We need to establish a regular extend time of savoring the Bread of Life, taking time to ensure our spiritual nutritional balance.
prayer: Holy God, help us to nourish our souls by abiding in Your presence and feasting on Your Word daily, rather than relying solely on spiritual supplements. May we cultivate a rich diet of prayer, Scripture, and reflection to grow ever closer to You. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1725878279a462c6
subject   : Subject: RECEIVING TRUE NOURISHMENT (5-28-20)

date      : Wed, 27 May 2020 18:29:29 -0500

===================================================================

eats *

*this bread will live **forever. This bread is my flesh, which I will
give **for
the life of *

*the world.” *(Jn. 6:51)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Have we ever taken the time to study the list of medications and
supplements we take, much of which our human bodies

can normally get from a healthy diet

and ten minutes of fresh air and sunshine an provide. How often do we do
the same with our spiritual health?

We depend on supplements—some else’s insights, Sunday sermons, a brief
nugget heard on T V, as our entire spiritual intake for the week. We lean
on supplements rather than a rich diet of daily Bible

reading, prayer time, and reflection with Jesus. In (Jn. 15:7) He says we
should “abide” with Him. *We need to **establish *

*a regular extend time of savoring the*

*Bread of Life, taking time to ensure our spiritual **nutritional balance.*


*Pastor Sather*

subject: LOOK TO CHRIST DURING ADVERSITIES
verse: As water reflects a face, so one’s life reflects the heart. (Proverbs 27:19)
reflection:
When I was diagnosed with cancer a few years ago, my response wasn’t anger or bitterness. But when you first hear that C. word it does shake you. But my wife and I drew on Jesus for comfort. Even though we did not know what the outcome would
be, our faith grew. We continued to believe that Jesus was in control and was drawing us close, and He was. When I look back at that “spiritual checkup” I realize that we responded with love, faith, strength, and hope because of Jesus. When we face
adversity, Jesus wants His love and hope to spill out of us. His love fills us to overflowing and changes the way we respond to life and those around us.
prayer: Loving God, thank You for being our source of comfort, strength, and hope in times of adversity. Fill us with Your love so that it may overflow to others, transforming our responses to life's challenges. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1725da653c4b6737
subject   : Subject: LOOK TO CHRIST DURING ADVERSITIES (5-29-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 28 May 2020 18:38:01 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*As water reflects a face, so one’s life reflects **the heart. *(Pro. 27:19)



*Today’s Reflection:*

When I was diagnosed with cancer a few years ago, my response wasn’t anger
or bitterness. But when you first hear that C. word it does shake you. But my
wife and I drew on Jesus for comfort. Even though we did not know what the
outcome would

be, our faith grew. We continued to believe that Jesus was in control and
was drawing us close, and He was. When I look back at that “spiritual checkup”
I realize that we responded with love, faith, strength, and hope because of
Jesus. When we face

adversity, Jesus wants His love and hope

to spill out of us. *His love fills us to overflowing and **changes the way
we respond to life and those **around us.*

*Pastor Sather*

subject: AVOID EARTHLY TEMPTATIONS
verse: Happiness or sadness or wealth should not keep anyone from doing God’s work. Those in frequent contact with the things of the world should make good use of them  without becoming attached to them, for  this world and all it contains will pass-away. (I Corinthians 7:30-31)
reflection:
Paul urges believers not to regard marriage, home, or financial security as the ultimate goals of life. As much as possible, we should live unhindered by the cares of this world, not getting involved with burdensome mortgages, budgets, investments, or debts that might keep
us from doing God’s work. A married man or woman, as Paul points out (7:33, 34) must take care of earthly response abilities but make every effort to keep them modest and manageable. Ask Jesus to show you if there are possessions or activities that distract you.
prayer: Lord of Life, help us to prioritize Your work above worldly concerns and possessions, and grant us wisdom to manage our earthly responsibilities in ways that allow us to serve You wholeheartedly. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1726291e5e4f67a9
subject   : Subject: AVOID EARTHLY TEMPTATIONS (5-30-20)

to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 29 May 2020 17:33:48 -0500
===================================================================

===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*Happiness or sadness or wealth should not keep anyone **from doing God’s
work. Those in frequent contact with **the things of the world should make
good use of them *

*without **becoming attached to them, for *

*this world and **all it contains will pass-away. *(I Cor. 7:30-31)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Paul urges believers not to regard marri-age, home, or financial security
as the ultimate goals of life. As much as poss-ible, we should live
unhindered by the cares of this world, not getting involved with burdensome
mortgages, budgets, investments, or debts that might keep

us from doing God’s work. A married

man or woman, as Paul points out (7:33, 34) must take care of earthly
responsi-

bilities but make every effort to keep

them modest and manageable. *Ask Jesus to show you if **there are
possessions or activities that distract **you.*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: ENDING AND BEGINNING
verse: Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come, the old has gone, the new is here! (2 Corinthians 5:17)
reflection:
Revelation 1:8 reads, “I am the Alpha and the Omega, the beginning and the ending, saith the Lord.” Have you ever given thought to how many things about us are constantly ending and beginning?
For the believer, there is constant changes going on.
Life is being reshaped. It begins in a new-birth experience and as we grow in the Lord, this new life constantly changes, and we are reshaped into the image of Jesus Christ by the Holy Spirit
dwelling within us. As you see the change going on in the world, recognize the ways Jesus has given you greater purpose and made you new.
prayer: Eternal God, as we witness the constant changes in our world and in ourselves, help us to recognize and embrace the transformative power of Your Spirit, reshaping us into the image of Christ. May we find greater purpose and renewal through Your enduring presence, always remembering that You are our beginning and our end. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17267b342349b984
subject   : Subject: ENDING AND BEGINNING (5-31-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 30 May 2020 17:28:21 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation **has come, the old
has gone, the new is here! *(2 Cor. 5:17)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Rev. 1:8 reads, *“I am the Alpha and the Omega, **the beginning and the
ending, saith the Lord.” *Have you ever given thought to how many things about
us

are constantly ending and beginning?

For the believer, there is constant changes going on. Life is being
re-shaped. It begins in a new-birth experience and as we grow in the Lord,
this new life constantly changes, and we are reshaped into the

image of Jesus Christ by the Holy Spirit

dwelling within us. *As you see the change going **on in the world,
recognize the*

*ways **Jesus has **given you greater purpose and made you new.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: A PROGRESSIVE EXPERIENCE
verse: And we all, who with unveiled faces contemplate the Lord’s glory, are being transformed into His image with ever-increasing glory, which comes from the Lord, who is the Spirit. (2 Corinthians 3:18)
reflection:
The glory that the Spirit imparts to the believer is more excellent and lasts longer than the glory that Moses experienced. By gazing at the nature of God with unveiled minds we can be more like Him.
In the Good News we see the truth about Christ, and it transforms us morally as we under stand and apply it. Through learning about Christ’s life, we can understand how wonderful God is and what He is really like. As our knowledge deepens, The Holy Spirit helps us to change.
prayer: Holy God, as we gaze upon Your glory with unveiled minds, transform us by Your Spirit to reflect more of Your divine nature. Help us to understand and apply the truth about Christ, deepening our knowledge of Your wonderful character and changing us from the inside out. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1726d0b1a190a764
subject   : Subject: A PROGRESSIVE EXPERIENCE (6-1-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 31 May 2020 18:22:24 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*And we all, who with unveiled faces contemplate **the Lord’s glory, are
being transformed into His **image with ever-increasing glory, which
comes **from
the Lord, who is the Spirit. *(2 Cor. 3:18)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The glory that the Spirit imparts to the believer is more excellent and
lasts longer than the glory that Moses experienced. By gazing at the nature of
God with unveiled minds we can be more like Him. In the Good News we see
the truth about Christ, and it transforms us morally as we under-

stand and apply it. Through learning about Christ’s life, we can understand
how wonderful God is and what He is really like. *As our knowledge **deepens,
The Holy Spirit helps us to change.*

* Pastor Sather*
